gurmukhi: ਦੇਸ ਅੳੁਰ ਬਿਦੇਸ ਭੀਤਰ ਠੳੁਰ ਠੳੁਰ ਮਹੰਤ || ਨਾਚ ਨਾਚ ੳੁਠੇ ਸਭੈ ਜਨੁ ਅਾਜ ਲਾਗ ਬਸੰਤ ||੫੪||
transliteration: Des Aur Bides Bheetar Thaur Thaur Mahant|| Naach Naach Outhe Sabhai Jan(u) Aaj Laag Basant||54||
translation: The chieftains of various places are exhibiting their delight and all the people are dancing like the frolicsome people in the spring season.54.

gurmukhi: ਕਿੰਕਣੀਨ ਕੇ ਜਾਲ ਭੂਖਤਿ ਬਾਜ ਅੳੁ ਗਜਰਾਜ || ਸਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਦੲੇ ਦਿਜੇਸਨ ਅਾਜ ਕੳੁਸਲ ਰਾਜ ||
transliteration: Kinknin Ke Jaal Dhoodhat(i) Baaj Au Gadraaj|| Saaj Saaj Dae Dijesan Aaj Kaousal Raaj||
translation: The network of bells is seen decorate on the elephants and horses nd such-like elephants and horses have been presented by the kings to Dasrath, the husband of Kaushalya.

gurmukhi: ਰੰਕ ਰਾਜ ਭੲੇ ਘਨੇ ਤਹ ਰੰਕ ਰਾਜਨ ਜੈਸ || ਰਾਮ ਜਨਮਤ ਭਯੋ ੳੁਤਸਵ ਅੳੁਧ ਪੁਰ ਮੈ ਅੈਸ ||੫੫||
transliteration: Rank Raaj Bhae Ghane Tah Rank Raajan Jais|| Raam Janmat Bhayo Outsav Audh Pur Mai Ais||55||
translation: There has been festival in Ayodhya on the birth of ram that the beggars laden with gifts have become kinglike.55.

gurmukhi: ਦੁੰਦਭ ਅੳੁਰ ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਤੂਰ ਤੁਰੰਗ ਤਾਨ ਅਨੇਕ || ਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਬਜੰਤ ਛੀਨ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਬੀਨ ਬਿਸੇਖ ||
transliteration: Doundabh Aur Mridan Toor Turan Taan Anek|| Been Been Bajant Chheen Prabeen Been Bisekh||
translation: The tunes of drums and clarionets are being heard alongwith the sound of flutes and lyres.

gurmukhi: ਝਾਂਝ ਬਾਰ ਤਰੰਗ ਤੁਰਹੀ ਭੇਰਨਾਦਿ ਨਿਯਾਨ || ਮੋਹਿ ਮੋਹਿ ਗਿਰੇ ਧਰਾ ਪਰ ਸਰਬ ਬਯੋਮ ਬਿਵਾਨ ||੫੬||
transliteration: Jhaanjh Baar Taran Tur-hibhernaadh Niyaan|| Moh(i) Moh(i) Gire Dharaa Par Sarab Byom Bivaan||56||
translation: The sound of bells, walrus and kettledrums are audible and these sound are so attaractive that the air-vehicles of gods, being impressed are coming down to the earth.56.

gurmukhi: ਜੱਤ੍ਰ ਤੱਤ੍ਰ ਬਿਦੇਸ ਦੇਸਨ ਹੋਤ ਮੰਗਲਚਾਰ || ਬੈਠ ਬੈਠ ਕਰੈ ਲਗੇ ਸਭ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਬੇਦ ਬਿਚਾਰ ||
transliteration: Jattra Tattra Bides Desan Hot Mandalchaar|| Baith Baith Darai Lage Sabh Bipra Bed Bichaar||
translation: Here, there and everywhere the songs of praise are being sung and the Brahmins have begun the discussion on Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਧੂਪ ਦੀਪ ਮਹੀਪ ਗ੍ਰੇਹ ਸਨੇਹ ਦੇਤ ਬਨਾੲਿ || ਫੂਲ ਫੂਲ ਫਿਰੈ ਸਭੈ ਗਣ ਦੇਵ ਦੇਵਨ ਰਾੲਿ ||੫੭||
transliteration: Dhoop Deep Maheep Greh Saneh Det Bahaae|| Phool Phool Phirai Sabhai Gad Dev Devan Raae||57||
translation: Because of the incense and earthen lamps, the palace of the king has become so impressive that Indra alongwith gods are moving hither and thither in their delight.57.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਜ ਕਾਜ ਭੲੇ ਸਭੈ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਬੋਲਤ ਬੈਨ || ਭੂੰਮ ਭੂਰ ੳੁਠੀ ਜਯਤ ਧੁਨ ਬਾਜ ਬਾਜਤ ਗੈਨ ||
transliteration: Aaj Kaaj Bhae Sabhai Eh Bhaant(i) Dolat Hain|| Bhoonm Bhoor Outhijayat Dhoun Baaj Baajat Gadn||
translation: All the people are saying that on that day all their wishes have been fulfilled. The earth is filled with shouts of victory and the musical instruments are being played in the sky.

gurmukhi: ਅੈਨ ਅੈਨ ਧੁਜਾ ਬਧੀ ਸਭ ਬਾਟ ਬੰਦਨਵਾਰ || ਲੀਪ ਲੀਪ ਧਰੇ ਮੱਲਯਾਗਰ ਹਾਟ ਪਾਟ ਬਜਾਰ ||੫੮||
transliteration: Ain Ain Dhujaa Badhisabh Baat Bandanvaar|| Leep Leep Ddare Mallyaagad Haat Paat Bajaar||58||
translation: There are small flags at all the places, there are greetings on all the paths and all shops and bazaars have been plastered with sandalwood.58.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਤੁਰੰਗ ਕੰਚਨ ਦੇਤ ਦੀਨਨ ਦਾਨ || ਸਸਤ ਹਸਤ ਦੲੇ ਅਨੇਕਨ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਦੁਰਦ ਸਮਾਨ ||
transliteration: Saaj Saaj Turan Kanchannddet Deenan Daan|| Mast Hast Dae Anekan Indra Durad Samaan||
translation: The poor people are being given the horses decorated with gold, and many intoxicated elephants like Airavat (the elephant of Indra) are being given in charity.

gurmukhi: ਕਿੰਕਣੀ ਕੇ ਜਾਲ ਭੂਖਤ ਦੲੇ ਸਯੰਦਨ ਸੁੱਧ || ਗਾੲਿਨਨ ਕੇ ਪੁਰ ਮਨੋ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਅਾਵਤ ਬੁੱਧ ||੫੯||
transliteration: Kinkanike Jaal Dhoodhat Dae Syandan Suddh|| Gadenan Ke Pur Mano Eh Bhaant Aavat Buddh||59||
translation: The horses studded with bells are being given as gifts; it appears that in the city of singers, the prudence is coming by itself.59.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਦੲੇ ੲਿਤੇ ਜਿਹ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਨਹੀ ਪਾਰ || ਦਯੋਸ ਦਯੋਸ ਬਢੈ ਲਗਯੋ ਰਨਧੀਰ ਰਾਮਵਤਾਰ ||
transliteration: Baaj Saaj Dae Ite Jih Paaeeai Nahipaar|| Dyos Dyos Badhai Lagyo Randheer Raamavtaar||
translation: The innumerable horses and elephants were given as gifts by the king on one hand and Ram began to grow day by day on the other hand.

gurmukhi: ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰਨ ਕੀ ਸਭੈ ਬਿਧ ਦੀਨ ਤਾਹਿ ਸੁਧਾਰ || ਅਸਟ ਦਯੋਸਨ ਮੋ ਗੲੇ ਲੈ ਸਰਬ ਰਾਮਕੁਮਾਰ ||੬੦||
transliteration: Sastra Saastran Kisabhai Bidh Deen Taah(i) Sudhaar|| Ast Dyosan Mo Gad Lai Sarab Raamkoumaar||60||
translation: He was taught all the required wisdom of the arms and religious texts and Ram learned everything within eight days (i.e. a very short period).60.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਕਮਾਨ ਲੈ ਬਿਹਰੰਤ ਸਰਜੂ ਤੀਰ || ਪੀਤ ਪੀਤ ਪਿਛੋਰ ਕਾਰਨ ਧੀਰ ਚਾਰਹੁੰ ਬੀਰ ||
transliteration: Baan Paan Kamaan Lai Bihrant Sarjoo Teer|| Peet Peet Pichhodh Kaaran Dheer Chdaronh Beer||
translation: They began to roam on the banks of the Saryu river and all the four brother collected the yellow leaves and butterflies.
